page.title: 03WILDLIFE IN BLACKBURN.
page.content: There is a lot of wildlife in Blackburn as well as any other town or city in England but as Blackburn has a country park, part of the wildlife is congregated there. Birds and animals and many other types of wildlife depend on{Witton Park}for protection, eg great tits, magpies all build nests in the trees of Witton. Foxes, rabbits and badgers, all build underground homes in Witton. There are many other places in Blackburn that support wildlife. Fishmoor reservoir is just one of these places, it supports an abundance of wildlife eg foxes, hares, stoats as well as fish. It has been noted that the animals in question, face certain dangers every day, from both natural and manmade threats like predators and water and air pollution. However,we are optimistic about the future.
